section.title: DESCRIPTION
section.p: Deletes a bucket in the cluster. When the bucket is deleted all indexes on that bucket will also be deleted.

dd.p: Specfies the hostname of a node in the cluster. See the HOST FORMATS section for more information on specifying a hostname.
Specifies the username of the user executing the command. If you do not have a user account with permision to execute the command then it will fail with an unauthorized error.

Specifies the password of the user executing the command. If you do not have a user account with permision to execute the command then it will fail with an unauthorized error. If this argument is specified, but no password is given then the command will prompt the user for a password through non-echoed stdin. You may also specify your password by using the environment variable CB_REST_PASSWORD.
The name of the bucket to delete.

section.title: ENVIRONMENT AND CONFIGURATION VARIABLES
section.p: CB_REST_PASSWORD Specifies the password of the user executing the command. This environment variable allows you to specify a default argument for the -p/--password argument on the command line. It also allows the user to ensure that their password are not cached in their command line history.
CB_REST_PASSWORD Specifies the password of the user executing the command. This environment variable allows you to specify a default argument for the -p/--password argument on the command line.
